Key Arguments: The bill is seen as an abomination that should be abandoned entirely.
It is argued that the bill will diminish citizens' ability to speak out against false narratives promoted by the government.
The bill is perceived as a coercive attack on free speech, including political speech.
The bill excludes governments and other primary sources of misinformation from regulatory control.
The bill is seen as Orwellian and a threat to democracy.
The bill is viewed as a means to control narratives and limit debate on significant issues like climate change and COVID-19.
Notable Quotes: The proposed Bill will further erode trust and damage our democracy going forward.
Orwellian in the extreme, as the thin edge of a long wedge, the proposed Bill is an abomination.
For our democracy to flourish the Bill must be withdrawn.
It is therefore extremely concerning that the proposed Bill is de facto a coercive attack on free speech, including political speech.
